node.Title: College of Education, Health and Human Services
Writing Commons
node.Body:
Writing Commons Mission Statement:

  • As the university writing center, the Writing Commons supports KSU students at all levels and in every academic discipline with any projects that include writing.
  • We assist writers at every stage of the composing and revising process.
  • We help writers at every level of proficiency to experience the satisfaction of developing effective written communication.

All student writers can benefit from the feedback and support the Writing Commons provides.  Visit us to see how we can help you!

node.Title: Anthropology
node.Body:
Anthropology as a discipline is more relevant today than at any time in its distinguished history.

Anthropology is the academic discipline that studies humans holistically through an interdisciplinary lens. It combines science with humanities, biology with culture, history with prehistory and primates with language. It is by definition concerned with human diversity and the Anthropology department at Kent State University has provided primary leadership within academia in researching this important domain.

Anthropology trains students to think critically, write clearly and speak thoughtfully about what it means to be human. Methodologically, we emphasize both quantitative and qualitative evaluation and train students to go beyond the statistics.

By focusing on the complex linkages among the three subfields of Anthropology: Cultural Anthropology, Archaeology and Biological Anthropology—and by emphasizing the importance of interdisciplinary teamwork, we prepare students to survive in an increasingly multidisciplinary and multicultural world.

node.Title: Summer Sessions
node.Body:
Take Summer Classes Wherever You Are!

Whether you’re a current Kent State student, or attend a different college, Summer Sessions at Kent State are a great way to catch up and get ahead.

Hundreds">https://keys.kent.edu:44220/ePROD/bwlkffcs.P_AdvUnsecureCrseSearch?term_... of summer classes are available—including many you can take online. See how far you can advance – when you see yourself at Kent State this summer!

KENT STATE STUDENTS

node.Title: Graduate Studies
node.Body:
Kent State, with its eight-campus system in Northeast Ohio, serves the state and the nation with excellence through more than 50 master’s programs in more than 100 areas of specialization, as well as 23 doctoral programs with more than 50 specializations.

node.Title: EXCEL
node.Body:
[[{"fid":"20896","view_mode":"default","fields":{"format":"default","field_file_image_alt_text[und][0][value]":"","field_file_image_title_text[und][0][value]":"","field_bulk_image[und][0][fid]":"0","field_bulk_image[und][0][display]":"1"},"type":"media","link_text":null,"attributes":{"height":"305","width":"761","style":"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;","class":"media-element file-default"}}]]

EXCEL is a living-learning community for new freshmen Exploratory students, designed to assist with exploring careers, education, and leadership while moving students toward selecting their major by the end of freshmen year, so that students remain on their four year graduation track.

Mission Statement

The EXCEL (Explore, Careers, Education, Leadership) Living Learning Community is dedicated to providing the foundation for students to remain on their four year graduation path through the creation of an inspiring and engaging living learning community. EXCEL focuses on holistic learning involving the selection of a major, career exploration, academic success, and leadership. The environment within the EXCEL community fosters friendships and relationships with EXCEL students, EXCEL mentors; including, faculty and Staff members. The commitment of the EXCEL Living Learning Community is to provide enriching student experiences at Kent State University.

Goals

Goals of the EXCEL Living Learning Community are to create an atmosphere fostering immediate friendships and bonding among EXCEL students, peer mentors, faculty members, and staff members; to promote strong academic habits and practices; to increase global education awareness; to create opportunities to increase self-awareness and develop strong critical-think skills; to expose students to personal responsibility to self and to others; and, to engage students in leadership roles with a commitment to further develop academically successful and involved students, while providing an enriching experience at Kent State University.

Benefits
  • An assigned academic advisor in the Exploratory Advising Center located in Lake Hall.
  • Enrollment in a set of core classes and participation in study sessions with other EXCEL students.
  • Enrollment in an EXCEL First Year Experience (FYE) and Careers courses to research majors and careers.
  • Participation in thought provoking activities within an active and high energy environment in Lake Residence Hall.
  • Student programs, services and academic assistance tailored to enhance student success.
  • Peer mentors who plan awesome and fun activities while supporting positive student development.

   http://www2.kent.edu/undergradstudies/excel/images/DSC_0224_1.jpg" title="DSC_0224" alt="DSC_0224" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="166" height="111" hspace="0" vspace="0">  http://www2.kent.edu/undergradstudies/excel/images/photo_1.JPG" title="photo" alt="photo" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="273" height="111" hspace="0" vspace="0">  http://www2.kent.edu/undergradstudies/excel/images/DSC_0211_1.jpg" title="DSC_0211" alt="DSC_0211" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="166" height="111" hspace="0" vspace="0">

How do I participate?
  • Open to first year Exploratory students at Kent State University
  • On your Housing Application, you must select Lake Hall and EXCEL Community as your top choices

  • Look for a confirmation email from the EXCEL Coordinator approving your spot in the community

  • Get information on how to apply or">https://housing.res.kent.edu/">apply or contact us with your questions:

https://housing.res.kent.edu/HMSWebStudent/Login.asp?TargetPage=Default.... src="http://www2.kent.edu/undergradstudies/excel/images/applyNow_1.gif" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="226" height="56"> https://app-dev.us.kent.edu/test-web4/"> src="http://www2.kent.edu/undergradstudies/excel/images/excel-button_1.png" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="225" height="60">

Contact Us
EXCEL Living-Learning Community
Student Success Programs
330-672-9292
EXCEL">mailto:EXCEL@kent.edu">EXCEL@kent.edu

1125 Risman Drive
Kent, Ohio 44242-0001

node.Title: accessKSU
node.Body:
Kent State University Accessibility Liaison Welcomes You

Kent State University is committed to being a welcoming community to all. Please let us know how we can be helpful.

 Kent State University's Accessibility Liaison would like to assist you with attending our campus or accessing an event. If you are a visitor or a student, faculty or staff member with an accessibility issue that is other than academic or employment related and need an accommodation, please contact my office accessKSU">mailto:accessKSU@kent.edu">accessKSU@kent.edu

What does an "accommodation" or accessibility request look like?

  •  American Sign Language (ASL)  interpreters or closed captioning
  • Videophones location on campus
  • Materials for the visually impaired (enlarged font or Braille)
  • Accessible parking or curb cut out location information
  • Loaner Scooter and Wheelchair availability
  • Where to access buildings and elevator locations
  • First floor accessible restrooms
  • Location of universal restrooms, formerly known as gender neutral or family bathrooms
  • Assistance with access strategies for your specific need 
My name is Jacqueline Gee and I look forward to working with you!

If you have an accessibility concern please call (330) 672-8667 / Video Phone (330) 931-4441 or email me at accessksu">mailto:accessksu@kent.edu">accessksu@kent.edu.

Registered students seeking academic accommodations call Student Accessibility Services (SAS) at (330) 672-3391 or fax (330) 672-3763 or email SAS">mailto:SAS@kent.edu.">SAS@kent.edu.

University Faculty or Staff: for workplace accommodations call Amy Quillin, Ph.D. at (330) 672-8036 or email your request to aquillin">mailto:aquillin@kent.edu">aquillin@kent.edu.

node.Featured-Photo: ,

node.Title: Plagiarism
node.Body:
Academic honesty is the academy's most cherished value.

At this university, we seek to find truth in all its forms whether scientific, artistic, or political.  It is our expectation that Kent State students and faculty uphold the highest level of integrity, and take personal responsibility for the work they produce.  In a digital age where music, photos, and thoughts and ideas are shared freely across the globe, it is sometimes harder for individuals to determine where the line is, and how not to cross it.   However, the fundamental principles of intellectual property remain constant and pure—academic honesty is our highest responsibility. Simply put, Author Robert Fulghum said it well in his 1988 publication, All I Really Need To Know I Learned In Kindergarten, "don't take things that aren't yours."

Kent State's Committee on Plagiarism
